entry.title: Where the 12 Premiership sides need to strengthen in January - Celtic, Rangers, Hearts, Hibs and more
entry.summary: The Scottish Premiership is just seven days away from returning after its World Cup-induced hiatus. Managers have had plenty of time to mull over how the first 15 or 16 games of the campaign went, while also being able to analyse their squad ahead of the January transfer window. The Scotsman looks at what each of the 12 top-flight sides may need to do next month...

entry.title: 'Rangers just not as good as Celtic': Hibs manager Lee Johnson believes bigger picture was missed with Giovanni van Bronckhorst and says Michael Beale 'markets himself well'
entry.summary: It shouldn’t be Michael Beale who Lee Johnson believes ought to be occupying the technical area alongside that of the Hibs manager at Ibrox on Thursday.

entry.title: Celtic and Rangers World Cup windfall increases as Croatia reach World Cup semi-final v Argentina
entry.summary: Celtic and Rangers will both benefit financially from Croatia reaching the World Cup semi-final where they will face Argentina.

entry.title: Celtic's Josip Juranovic stands out as Croatia stun World Cup's great deceivers Brazil to reach semi-finals
entry.summary: Call it appetite and application ultimately trumping aesthetics and artistry.

entry.title: 'Best player' - Celtic's Josip Juranovic hailed by BBC Match of Day team for Croatia v Brazil display
entry.summary: Celtic's Josip Juranovic has been hailed as the "best player" on the field following a strong first-half display for Croatia against Brazil in the World Cup quarter-final.

entry.title: Celtic transfer latest: Midfielder could exit Parkhead with interest as new World Cup star linked
entry.summary: When Celtic return to competitive action a week on Saturday with a visit to Pittodrie to face third-place Aberdeen, they will do so in a commanding position. Rangers may have reduced the gap at he top to six points having played Hibs on Thursday but they will be expected to kick on.
